title: How to actually play this game
body:
First stop playing whatever champ you are playing.

Start playing Annie, Garen, & Sivir.

Next learn to play macro since these champs allow macro play.

Tada you might actually hit D5 if you learn.

replies.body: accept the reality that the team with an autofilled bot laner has a 78% chance to lose the game.

> [{quoted}](name=PhearBunny,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xRRqebY5,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-09-17T15:07:03.407+0000)
>
> accept the reality that the team with an autofilled bot laner has a 78% chance to lose the game.

How about just accepting the fact that the blue team has a %30 greater chance of winning? Accept that the results of any single match are little more than a coin toss and that meaningful trends will be observed over hundreds of matches.

> [{quoted}](name=PhearBunny,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xRRqebY5,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-09-17T15:07:03.407+0000)
>
> accept the reality that the team with an autofilled bot laner has a 78% chance to lose the game.

Also that even if ADC is their mainrole, they are stilled autofilled adc
You mean, me believing i'm always doing everything right and anything that goes wrong is my teammates fault doesn't work?

True, many years back I remember seeing a friend play reworked Garen(I think?), I liked him so much that I told myself If I ever play this game I'd play him. And I did, I played him, and he became my first even main AND my first ever one trick.
But as sokn as I saw other champioms I told myself if I want to improve I'd need to learn how to play more difficult champions, and I did.
That's when I added {{champion:164}} and {{champion:101}} to my main pool.
